lead_paragraph: In a salute to tradition and the American spirit, the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade celebrates its 75th anniversary this Thursday, with live coverage beginning at 9 a.m. on NBC. Winding their way from 77th Street and Central Park West down to Herald Square will be 33 floats, 9 specialty units (code for bagpipers and rifle corps), 39 clown groups, 14 dance and music groups, 12 marching bands, the Radio City Rockettes, celebrities like Charlotte Church and Usher, 4,000 Macy's employees with families and friends, performers from 4 Broadway shows, 15 novelty balloons and 15 giant helium balloons - including Snoopy and Woodstock (shown at right in last year's parade) and the newcomers Curious George, Pikachu and Jimmy Neutron.
abstract: NBC will cover Macy's Thanksgiving Day, which is celebrating its 75th anniversary; photo (S)
